title: Pedrerasaurus
text: Pedrerasaurus is an extinct genus of <a href="scincogekkonomorph">scincogekkonomorph</a> lizard from the <a href="Early%20Cretaceous">Early Cretaceous</a> (<a href="Barremian">Barremian</a>) <a href="La%20Pedrera%20de%20R%C3%BAbies%20Formation">La Pedrera de Rúbies Formation</a> of <a href="Spain">Spain</a>. The <a href="type%20species">type species</a> is "P. latifrontalis". It is similar in appearance to "<a href="Meyasaurus">Meyasaurus</a>", a widespread <a href="Early%20Cretaceous">Early Cretaceous</a> lizard that is also known from the <a href="Iberian%20Peninsula">Iberian Peninsula</a>. Both genera have bicuspid (two-<a href="Cusp%20%28dentistry%29">cusped</a>) teeth, but unlike "Meyasaurus", "Pedrerasaurus" has <a href="frontal%20bone">frontal bone</a>s that are not fused or constricted.
